Package org.svvrl.goal.core.io

Class FileHandler

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.io.FileHandler
public class FileHandler
extends java.lang.Object
The FileHandler provides methods for opening files and saving objects as files.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

  • Method Details

    • open

      public static Pair<Editable,​Codec> open​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException, UnsupportedException
      Opens a file and decodes the content of the file.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to be opened
      Returns:
      a pair of decoded object and the codec used
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure in reading the file
      UnsupportedException - if there is no codec that can decode the content of the file

    • open

      public static Pair<Editable,​Codec> open​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException, UnsupportedException
      Opens a file and decodes the content of the file.
      Parameters:
      file - a file to be opened
      Returns:
      a pair of decoded object and the codec used
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure in reading the file
      UnsupportedException - if there is no codec that can decode the content of the file

      Decodes the content from a specified input stream.
      Parameters:
      is - an input stream
      Returns:
      a pair of decoded object and the codec used
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure in reading content from the input stream
      UnsupportedException - if there is no codec that can decode the content from the input stream

    • open

      public static Pair<Editable,​Codec> open​(java.lang.String filename, Codec[] codecs) throws java.io.IOException, UnsupportedException
      Opens a file and decodes the content of the file by the first successful codec.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to be opened
      codecs - an array of codecs
      Returns:
      a pair of decoded object and the codec used
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure in reading the file
      UnsupportedException - if there is no codec in codecs that can decode the content of the file

    • open

      Opens a file and decodes the content of the file by the first successful codec.
      Parameters:
      file - a file to be opened
      codecs - an array of codecs
      Returns:
      a pair of decoded object and the codec used
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure in reading the file
      UnsupportedException - if there is no codec in codecs that can decode the content of the file

    • open

      public static Pair<Editable,​Codec> open​(java.io.InputStream is, Codec[] codecs) throws java.io.IOException, UnsupportedException
      Decodes the content from a specified input stream by the first successful codec.
      Parameters:
      is - an input stream
      codecs - an array of codecs
      Returns:
      a pair of decoded object and the codec used
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a failure in reading the content from the input stream
      UnsupportedException - if there is no codec in codecs that can decode the content from the input stream

    • importFromText

      public static Pair<Editable,​Codec> importFromText​(java.lang.String text) throws java.io.IOException, UnsupportedException
      Imports an editable object from text.
      Parameters:
      text - a string representing an editable object
      Returns:
      the editable object represented by the text
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is an error in reading the text
      UnsupportedException - if the text cannot be decoded by any codec

    • importFromText

      public static Pair<Editable,​Codec> importFromText​(java.lang.String text, Codec[] codecs) throws java.io.IOException, UnsupportedException
      Imports an editable object from text.
      Parameters:
      text - a string representing an editable object
      codecs - codecs used to decode the object from the text
      Returns:
      the editable object represented by the text
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is an error in reading the text
      UnsupportedException - if the text cannot be decoded by any codec

    • save

      public static void save​(Editable obj, java.lang.String filename)
      Encodes an object by the first applicable codec and saves that encoded data to a file.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be encoded
      filename - the name of the file to hold the encoded data

    • save

      public static void save​(Editable obj, java.io.File file)
      Encodes an object by the first applicable codec and saves that encoded data to a file.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be encoded
      file - the file to hold the encoded data

    • save

      public static void save​(Editable obj, java.io.File file, Codec codec)
      Encodes an object by a specified codec and saves that encoded data to a file.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be encoded
      file - the file to hold the encoded data
      codec - a codec used to encode the object

    • save

      public static void save​(Editable obj, java.io.OutputStream out)
      Encodes an object by the first applicable codec and saves the encoded data to an output channel.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be encoded
      out - the output channel for the encoded data

    • save

      public static void save​(Editable obj, java.io.OutputStream out, Codec codec)
      Encodes an object by a specified codec and saves the encoded data to an output channel.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be encoded
      out - the output channel for the encoded data
      codec - the codec used to encode obj
